history.content: Please rely on assist.org only. Courses do not fulfill requirements by association.

I’m looking to satisfy an ENGIN 7 requirement.
 
Glendale Community College offers the course ENGR 156 (Programming and Problem Solving in MATLAB), which according to assist.org does not satisfy the E7 requirement.

However, according to c-id.net, ENGR 156 is considered an equivalent course to ENGIN 136 (Computer Programming for Engineers Using MATLAB) offered by Diablo Valley College - which does satisfy the E7 requirement per assist.org.

I’m a bit unsure whether I should take ENGR 156 over the winter recess, because there are 2 articulations that appear to contradict each other. 

Does ENGR 156 satisfy the E7 requirement? Thanks in advance.
history.subject: Question on whether CCC course satisfies major requirement
